intro: Biophytum abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian false heather, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Biophytum abyssinicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
